title: Italian town sells €1 houses with no deposit required
description: With more and more Italian towns offering up dilapidated homes for next to nothing, potential buyers have been somewhat spoiled for choice.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene's tactics called a 'pain in the a**'
description: Tactics by hardline House Republicans like Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) to delay legislation that has broad support from both parties has been called a "pain in the a**" by one Republican. CNN's Gloria Borger explains why this could end up hurting them.

title: See Thai PM spray journalists with sanitizer at news conference
description: Thailand's Prime Minister, Prayut Chan-o-cha, responded in an unusual way during a news conference where he was asked about a cabinet reshuffle.

title: Beautiful private island in Bahamas goes up for sale
description: What's better than having your own luxury resort in the Bahamas? Owning your own private island in the Bahamas.

title: Disney+ reaches a major milestone
description: Disney+, the focal point of Disney's media empire, has achieved a significant milestone.

title: Hawaii declares an emergency as flooding causes extensive damage, including bridge collapses
description: The state of Hawaii is under an emergency proclamation as the state struggles with widespread damage from flooding.

title: The world needs all the doctors it can get right now. This cancer patient is risking the time she has left to become one
description: Perched on her living room couch, cup of tea in hand, Krista Bose rattles off complex medical terms without the slightest hesitation, then pauses to patiently explain each one in layman's terms as if speaking to her own patient. Bose, though, is the patient, and what she's describing is her own prognosis.

title: The Duchess of Sussex made a formal complaint to ITV after Piers Morgan's comments about her, expressing concern about the impact on others
Second death of official from Aung San Suu Kyi's party raises fears of Myanmar military detention
description: An official from ousted Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi's party has died in custody following alleged torture, the second such death while in detention of junta forces this week, according to a watchdog group.

title: Trump's clash with GOP over using his name in fundraising ignites midterm worries
description: Donald Trump's push to route his supporters' money through his own political apparatus, rather than traditional Republican campaign committees, has ignited fears among GOP donors and operatives that the former president could hamstring the party's efforts to win House and Senate majorities in next year's midterm elections.

title: Black journalists say UK media 'in denial' about racism
description: More than 160 journalists of color have rebuked a UK media industry body for claiming that racism played no part in coverage of Meghan, Duchess of Sussex.

title: Nigerian startup Flutterwave secures $170 million in capital injections from investors, now valued at over $1 billion
description: Flutterwave, an African fintech startup has secured $170 million in capital injections from investors, the firm said in a statement Wednesday.

title: Media freedom fight threatens to escalate UK-China tensions
description: Beijing has summoned Britain's ambassador to China over an article she wrote on press freedom, escalating a bitter row between the two countries that has spilled over to the media industry.

title: How pandemic unfolds in US depends on how Americans act in critical weeks ahead: CDC director
description: Nearly one in 10 Americans -- more than 32 million people -- are now fully vaccinated against Covid-19, according to data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

title: The $1.9 trillion Covid-19 relief bill is here
description: US President Joe Biden's $1.9 trillion Covid-19 relief bill is expected to pass Congress this morning, dramatically reshaping the country's economy and giving a big push to its fight against the pandemic.

title: Here's what we know so far about the massive Microsoft Exchange hack
description: Many security experts remain alarmed about the large, Chinese-linked hack of Microsoft's Exchange email service a week after the attack was first reported.

title: What can fully vaccinated people do? An expert weighs in
description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention issued long-awaited guidance on what fully vaccinated people can safely do, and with it, an opening: There's more opportunity to see our loved ones again.

title: As Texas governor lifts state mask mandate, here's what we know
description: Texans will no longer be under a statewide mandate to wear masks in public as of Wednesday, but they shouldn't be too quick to throw out their face coverings.

title: 'This horror has to stop.' Spiritual advisers to death row inmates decry recent wave of federal executions
description: It wasn't until Yusuf Nur was inside the execution chamber, standing next to a condemned man strapped to a gurney, that he understood why he'd been asked to be present.

title: Erling Haaland breaks multiple records as his goal-scoring streak continues in the Champions League
description: They say scoring goals is the hardest part of soccer but Erling Braut Haaland continues to make the process look easy.

title: Biden's Covid relief bill is huge, ambitious and about to pass
In a country where monthly minimum wage is $0.65, condoms cost $1 to $4
description: Venezuelan women face a lack of affordable contraceptives which has put their health at risk. Many Venezuelans have to choose between getting food and buying contraceptives due to the sky-high prices of birth control supplies. CNN's Rafael Romo reports.

title: Olympic swimmer Katie Ledecky on training in a backyard pool
description: A backyard pool in California might be the last place you'd expect to find one of the world's greatest swimmers in training, but that was the reality for Katie Ledecky when the pandemic forced facilities to shut last year.

title: Serving police officer arrested in hunt for missing London woman
description: A serving London Metropolitan Police officer has been arrested in connection with the disappearance of a 33-year-old woman, the police service said Tuesday in a statement.

title: What Dubai looked like before it boomed
description: Dubai is a desert phenomenon. In the space of 50 years, it has grown from a small trading outpost into one of the planet's most iconic cities.

title: Lady Gaga tweets photo from the set of new movie with Adam Driver
description: Lady Gaga set the internet alight on Tuesday after she posted a photo from the set of the forthcoming Ridley Scott movie, "House of Gucci."

title: Cristiano Ronaldo commits 'unforgivable error'
description: Cristiano Ronaldo's "unforgivable error" in extra-time against 10-man Porto in the Champions League proved decisive as Juventus was dumped out by the Portuguese side.

title: Rio votes to put Pele's name on famous Maracana stadium
description: Brazil's world famous Maracana stadium is to get a new name, after the Rio de Janeiro state legislature voted on Tuesday to change its official title to the Edson Arantes do Nascimento -- Rei Pele stadium.

title: China building offensive, aggressive military, top US Pacific commander says
description: China is assembling an increasingly offensive military and expanding its regional footprint, as Beijing steps up efforts to supplant American military power in Asia, a top US commander warned Congress on Tuesday.

title: Texas authorities investigating allegations of racism and bullying of a 13-year-old by his classmates during sleepover
description: Texas school and law enforcement officials have launched investigations after videos surfaced showing a 13-year-old allegedly being bullied by classmates during a sleepover in a home in Plano.

title: Iran tried to recruit me as a spy, says former prisoner Kylie Moore-Gilbert
description: A British-Australian academic said she suffered "psychological torture" while jailed in Iran and claims Tehran tried to recruit her as a spy, in her first interview since she was released last year.

title: Roger Mudd, longtime TV journalist, dies at 93
description: Television journalist Roger Mudd, who was once Walter Cronkite's primary substitute at CBS, died Tuesday at his home in Fairfax County, Virginia, his family said.

title: How China plans to strengthen its high-tech might
description: China's latest 5-year master plan gives insight on how Chinese authorities plan to strengthen its high-tech might. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout explains.

title: China and Russia agree to build joint lunar space station
description: China and Russia have agreed to jointly construct a lunar space station that will be "open to all countries," the China National Space Administration said in a statement on Tuesday.

title: Facing recall, California Gov. Newsom pleads for optimism and patience
description: Facing a recall effort that has threatened his political future, California Gov. Gavin Newsom acknowledged Tuesday night the fatigue and frustration that many Californians are feeling after a year of sacrifices.

title: Permanent dissent: Protesters get inked for democracy
description: Throughout Myanmar's month-long demonstrations against the resumption of military rule, artists have helped shape how the protests are expressed visually, from moving illustrations of demonstrators who have died, to huge murals, roadside artworks and satirical protest signs mocking coup leader General Min Aung Hlaing.

title: Van Jones: You know you're desperate when you go against Oprah
description: CNN's Chris Cuomo, Van Jones and CNN political analyst Natasha Alford discuss why some members of the political right are speaking out about Oprah Winfrey's interview with Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex.

title: Westerners are increasingly scared of traveling to China as threat of detention rises
description: Jeff Wasserstrom is a self-proclaimed China specialist who is seriously considering never returning to China -- at least, he says, not while President Xi Jinping is in power.

title: Kia warns some owners to park their vehicles outside due to fire risk
description: Kia is issuing a recall for nearly 380,000 Sportage SUVs and Cadenza sedans due to a problem that could cause them to catch fire.

title: Record number of children in border patrol custody at migrant facilities
description: CNN's Rosa Flores is at the US-Mexico border waiting for access to a facility housing migrant children after reports of a record number of children in border patrol custody.

title: CEO makes striking statement on the NASDAQ floor
description: Bumble CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd discusses what differentiates the dating app from others in the market, highlighting the company's commitment to women.

title: Bidens' dog goes from White House to dog house after bite incident
description: The White House confirms the Bidens' dog bit someone but denies he's in exile. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Sea level rise is increasing fastest in populous coastal areas, study says
description: Coastal communities are experiencing sea level rise four times worse than global water rise, according to a new study released Monday.

title: Mother shares how she connects with son through music
description: Viewers share things with Anderson that are positive in their lives during quarantine. Watch "Full Circle" Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6p E.T.
